description:
Currently, most single cell protocols require the preparation of a single cell suspension from fresh tissue, a major roadblock to clinical deployment, to archived materials and to certain tissues such as adult brain. In the adult brain the harsh enzymatic dissociation harms the integrity of the cells and their RNA, and biases toward easily dissociated cell types, and is restricted to young animals.

 

We developed DroNc-seq, a droplet microfluidic and DNA barcoding technique for analysis of RNA profiles of single nuclei from fresh, frozen or lightly fixed tissues at high throughput and low cost. The utility of DroNc-Seq lies in working with hard-to-dissociate, frozen and/or archived tissues. To demonstrate the utility of this technique, we sequenced over 39 thousand nuclei from mouse and human archived brain samples, including post-mortem human brain tissue from GTEx project.
before_start: Drop-seq Lysis Buffer (DLB6; a 10 ml stock consists of 4 ml of nuclease-free H2O, 3 ml 20% Ficoll PM‐400 (Sigma, Cat # F5415-50ML), 100 µl 20% Sarkosyl (Teknova, Inc., Cat # S3377), 400 µl 0.5M EDTA (Life Technologies), 2 ml 1M Tris pH 7.5 (Sigma), and 500 µl 1M DTT (Teknova, Inc., Cat # D9750), where the DTT is added fresh before every experiment)

materials.reagent_name: Nextera XT sample prep kit, 96 samples
Barcoded bead, sequence: TTTTTTTAAGCAGTGGTATCAACGCAGAGTACJJJJJJJJJJJJ NNNNNNNNT(30); where J=split-pool oligo; N=random oligo
emplate Switch Oligo, AAGCAGTGGTATCAACGCAGAGTGAATrGrGrG (IDT, custom RNA oligo, HPLC purified)
SMART PCR primer, AAGCAGTGGTATCAACGCAGAGT (IDT, custom DNA oligo, standard desalting)
P5-PCR hybrid oligo AATGATACGGCGACCACCGAGATCTACACGCCTGTC CGCGGAAGCAGTGGTATCAACGCAGAGT*A*C, (IDT, custom DNA oligo)
Custom Read1 primer, GCCTGTCCGCGGAAGCAGTGGTATCAACGCAGAGTAC (IDT, custom DNA oligo, standard desalting)

protocol_affiliation: Broad Institute, Harvard University,Broad Institute,Droplet microfluidics, Broad Institute,Harvard University
manuscript_citation:
Massively parallel single-nucleus RNA-seq with DroNc-seq

  • Naomi Habib, Inbal Avraham-Davidi, Anindita Basu, Tyler Burks, Karthik Shekhar, Matan Hofree, Sourav R Choudhury, François Aguet, Ellen Gelfand, Kristin Ardlie, David A Weitz, Orit Rozenblatt-Rosen, Feng Zhang, and Aviv Regev.
    Nature Methods doi:10.1038/nmeth.4407

groups.group_name: Human Cell Atlas Method Development Community

keywords: single nuclei, high throughput, RNA-seq, droplet microfluidics, DNA barcode, frozen, RNAlater, tissue, hippocampus, PFC
authors: Anindita Basu,Inbal Avraham-Davidi,Naomi Habib,Aviv Regev,Feng Zhang,Karthik Shekhar,Matan Hofree,David Weitz,Orit Rozenblatt-Rosen,Tyler Burks,Sourav Choudhury,François Aguet,Ellen Gelfand,Kristin Ardlie
guidelines:
[Please note that this protocol is originally published at Protocol Exchange:

 

Anindita Basu, Inbal Avraham-Davidi, Naomi Habib, et al. DroNc-seq step-by-step. Protocol Exchange (2017) doi:10.1038/protex.2017.094]

 

Equipment 

 

a. Microfluidic chip (see CAD file). The unit in the CAD provided is 1 unit = 1 µm; channel depth on device is 75 µm.
b. Drop-seq microfluidic setup (see reference):
- optical microscope (Olympus IX83)
- Fast camera (Photron SA5)
- Three syringe pumps (KD Scientific, KDS910)
- Magnetic Stirrer (VP Scientific, #710D2)
c. Invitrogen Qubit 3.0 Fluorometer
d. Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer
e. Illumina NextSeq 500

 
The protocol workflow is as follows:
 
1. Beads preparation
2. Cell culture
3. Tissue preservation
4. Nuclei isolation
5. Microfluidics
6. Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)
7. Post RT wash, exonuclease I treatment and PCR
8. WTA library QC and Nextera library prep
9. Sequencing

We thank Rhiannon Macare, Assaf Rotem, Christoph Muus and Eugene Drokhlyansky for helpful discussions, Talia Habib for babysitting, Timothy Tickle and Asma Bankapur for technical support, Leslie Gaffney and Ania Hupalowska for help with graphics. Microfluidic devices were fabricated at the Center for Nanoscale Systems, Harvard University, member of NNIN, supported by NSF award no. 1541959. F.Z. is a New York Stem Cell Foundation-Robertson Investigator. F.Z. is supported by NIH through NIMH (5DP1-MH100706 and 1R01-MH110049), NSF, HHMI, the New York Stem Cell, Simons, Paul G. Allen Family, and Vallee Foundations; and James and Patricia Poitras, Robert Metcalfe, and David Cheng. D.A.W. thanks NSF DMR-1420570, NSF DMR-1310266 and NIH P01HL120839 grants for their support. NH is a HHMI fellow for Helen Hey Whitney Foundation. N.H., A.B., I.A.D., D.A.W., F.Z. and A.R. are inventors on international patent application PCT/US16/59239 filed by the Broad Institute, Harvard and MIT, relating to method of this manuscript. GTEx is supported by the Common Fund of the Office of the Director of NIH, through Contract HHSN268201000029C (to K.A LDACC, Broad Institute).
 
Corresponding authors:
Aviv Regev (aregev@broadinstitute.org) and Feng Zhang (zhang@broadinstitute.org)
 
References:
 
Macosko, E. Z. et al. Highly Parallel Genome-wide Expression Profiling of Individual Cells Using Nanoliter Droplets. Cell 161, 1202-1214, doi:10.1016/j.cell.2015.05.002 (2015).

components.data: Beads preparation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Beads preparation

components.data: Count beads at 1:1 dilution in 20% PEG solution, using a disposable Fuchs-Rosenthal hemocytometer (VWR, Cat # 22-600-102) and resuspend beads at concentrations ranging between 325,000 and 350,000 per ml.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Count beads at 1:1 dilution in 20% PEG solution, using a disposable Fuchs-Rosenthal hemocytometer (VWR, Cat # 22-600-102) and resuspend beads at concentrations ranging between 325,000 and 350,000 per ml.

components.data: Cell culture
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Cell culture

components.data: Cell lines are cultured according to ATCC’s instructions. For DroNc-seq, wash cells once with 1x PBS, scrape them with 2 ml nuclease- and protease-free Nuclei EZ lysis or EZ PREP buffer (Sigma, Cat # EZ PREP NUC-101) and process as tissues, described below.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cell lines are cultured according to ATCC’s instructions. For DroNc-seq, wash cells once with 1x PBS, scrape them with 2 ml nuclease- and protease-free Nuclei EZ lysis or EZ PREP buffer (Sigma, Cat # EZ PREP NUC-101) and process as tissues, described below.

source_data.title: Nuclease- and protease-free Nuclei EZ lysis or EZ PREP buffer

components.data: Tissue preservation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Tissue preservation

components.data: Tissue samples may be flash-frozen on dry ice and stored at -80°C until they are processed for nuclei isolation. To preserve tissue in RNAlater, samples are placed in ice-cold RNAlater (ThermoFisher Scientific, Cat # AM7020) and stored at 4°C overnight.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Tissue samples may be flash-frozen on dry ice and stored at -80°C until they are processed for nuclei isolation. To preserve tissue in RNAlater, samples are placed in ice-cold RNAlater (ThermoFisher Scientific, Cat # AM7020) and stored at 4°C overnight.

components.name: Section

source_data.section: Beads preparation

components.data: Isolate beads smaller than 40 µm, using a 40 µm cell strainer (PluriSelect, Cat # 43-50040-03).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Isolate beads smaller than 40 µm, using a 40 µm cell strainer (PluriSelect, Cat # 43-50040-03).

source_data.section: Tissue preservation

components.data: Nuclei isolation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Nuclei isolation

components.data: Use either fresh, frozen or RNAlater fixed tissue or fresh cells as input material.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use either fresh, frozen or RNAlater fixed tissue or fresh cells as input material.

components.data: Nuclei isolation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Nuclei isolation

components.data: Prepare Nuclei Suspension Buffer (NSB; consisting of 1x PBS, 0.01% BSA (New England Biolabs, Cat # B9000S) and 0.1% RNAse inhibitor (Clontech, Cat #2313A)).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare Nuclei Suspension Buffer (NSB; consisting of 1x PBS, 0.01% BSA (New England Biolabs, Cat # B9000S) and 0.1% RNAse inhibitor (Clontech, Cat #2313A)).

components.data: Nuclei isolation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Nuclei isolation

components.data: Dounce homogenize tissue samples (smaller than 0.5 cm) or cell pellets in 2 ml of ice-cold Nuclei EZ lysis buffer (Sigma, #EZ PREP NUC-101). For brain tissue: grind 20-25 times with pestle A, followed by 20-25 times with pestle B (This may need to be modified for other tissues). Move sample to a 15 ml conical tube, add 2 ml of ice-cold Nuclei EZ lysis buffer and incubate on ice for 5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dounce homogenize tissue samples (smaller than 0.5 cm) or cell pellets in 2 ml of ice-cold Nuclei EZ lysis buffer (Sigma, #EZ PREP NUC-101). For brain tissue: grind 20-25 times with pestle A, followed by 20-25 times with pestle B (This may need to be modified for other tissues). Move sample to a 15 ml conical tube, add 2 ml of ice-cold Nuclei EZ lysis buffer and incubate on ice for 5 minutes.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 10 of DroNc-seq step-by-step
source_data.annotation: It looks like you don't put any RNase inhibitor in the EZ Nuc buffer. You use it as is? Is that correct? Do you feel that, since you used RNAlater, you don't need to have RNase inhibitors during the lysis? What about if using fresh or frozen tissue?
source_data.thread_text: It looks like you don't put any RNase inhibitor in the EZ Nuc buffer. You use it as is? Is that correct? Do you feel that, since you used RNAlater, you don't need to have RNase inhibitors during the lysis? What about if using fresh or frozen tissue?
source_data.body: It looks like you don't put any RNase inhibitor in the EZ Nuc buffer. You use it as is? Is that correct? Do you feel that, since you used RNAlater, you don't need to have RNase inhibitors during the lysis? What about if using fresh or frozen tissue?

components.data: Nuclei isolation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Nuclei isolation

components.data: Collect nuclei by centrifugation at 500 x g for 5 minutes at 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Collect nuclei by centrifugation at 500 x g for 5 minutes at 4°C.

components.data: Nuclei isolation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Nuclei isolation

components.data: Discard supernatant and carefully resuspend nuclei in 4 ml of ice-cold Nuclei EZ lysis buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard supernatant and carefully resuspend nuclei in 4 ml of ice-cold Nuclei EZ lysis buffer.

components.data: Nuclei isolation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Nuclei isolation

components.data: Resuspend isolated nuclei in 1 ml of NSB, and filter through a 35 μm cell strainer (Corning, Cat # 352235). Stain 10 µl of the single nuclei suspension with DAPI (Fisher, Cat # D1306), load on an NI hemocytometer, and count under a microscope. A final concentration of 300,000 nuclei/ml is used for DroNc-seq experiments. Proceed immediately to microfluidic droplet co-encapsulation.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend isolated nuclei in 1 ml of NSB, and filter through a 35 μm cell strainer (Corning, Cat # 352235). Stain 10 µl of the single nuclei suspension with DAPI (Fisher, Cat # D1306), load on an NI hemocytometer, and count under a microscope. A final concentration of 300,000 nuclei/ml is used for DroNc-seq experiments. Proceed immediately to microfluidic droplet co-encapsulation.

components.data: Microfluidics
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Microfluidics

components.data: Collect resulting emulsion via PE2 tubing into a 50 ml Falcon tube for a period of ~22 min each, and incubate at room temperature for up to 45 min before proceeding to break droplets.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Collect resulting emulsion via PE2 tubing into a 50 ml Falcon tube for a period of ~22 min each, and incubate at room temperature for up to 45 min before proceeding to break droplets.

components.data: Microfluidics
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Microfluidics

components.data: Flow both bead and nuclei suspensions at 1.5 ml/hr each, along with carrier oil (BioRad Sciences, Cat # 186-4006) loaded in 10 ml syringes (BD Scientific, Cat # BD309695) and flown at 16 ml/hr to co-encapsulate single nuclei and beads in ~75 µm drops at 4,500 drops/sec and double Poisson loading concentrations.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Flow both bead and nuclei suspensions at 1.5 ml/hr each, along with carrier oil (BioRad Sciences, Cat # 186-4006) loaded in 10 ml syringes (BD Scientific, Cat # BD309695) and flown at 16 ml/hr to co-encapsulate single nuclei and beads in ~75 µm drops at 4,500 drops/sec and double Poisson loading concentrations.

components.data: Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)

components.data: Emulsion collected after microfluidic co-encapsulation has the droplets cream to the top with clear oil collected under the droplets. Carefully remove the excess clear oil, add 30 ml of 6x SSC (Teknova, Inc., Cat # S0282) into each 50 ml Falcon collection tube, agitate it vigorously, and add 1 ml of 1H,1H,2H,2H-Perfluorooctan-1-ol (SynQuest Laboratories, Cat # 647-42-7).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Emulsion collected after microfluidic co-encapsulation has the droplets cream to the top with clear oil collected under the droplets. Carefully remove the excess clear oil, add 30 ml of 6x SSC (Teknova, Inc., Cat # S0282) into each 50 ml Falcon collection tube, agitate it vigorously, and add 1 ml of 1H,1H,2H,2H-Perfluorooctan-1-ol (SynQuest Laboratories, Cat # 647-42-7).

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 3 of DroNc-seq step-by-step
source_data.annotation: It is recommended that all washes following this step be performed and the beads temporarily stored on ice.
source_data.thread_text: It is recommended that all washes following this step be performed and the beads temporarily stored on ice.
source_data.body: It is recommended that all washes following this step be performed and the beads temporarily stored on ice.

components.data: Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)

components.data: Vigorously shake the tubes by hand and centrifuge at 1,000 x g for 1 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Vigorously shake the tubes by hand and centrifuge at 1,000 x g for 1 min.

components.data: Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)

components.data: Carefully remove the supernatant from each tube and squirt an additional 30 ml of 6x SSC to kick up the beads from the oil-water interface into the aqueous phase.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully remove the supernatant from each tube and squirt an additional 30 ml of 6x SSC to kick up the beads from the oil-water interface into the aqueous phase.

components.data: Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)

components.data: Remove the beads that were kicked up momentarily into the SSC with a 25 ml pipette and transfer them into a clean 50 ml Falcon tube, leaving the heavier oil behind.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the beads that were kicked up momentarily into the SSC with a 25 ml pipette and transfer them into a clean 50 ml Falcon tube, leaving the heavier oil behind.

components.data: Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)

components.data: Centrifuge the newly transferred beads and SSC mix again at 1,000 x g for 1 min; carefully remove the supernatant leaving ~1 ml of SSC and bead sediment behind.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the newly transferred beads and SSC mix again at 1,000 x g for 1 min; carefully remove the supernatant leaving ~1 ml of SSC and bead sediment behind.

components.data: Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)

components.data: Carefully transfer remaining SSC and bead mix into a 1.5 ml micro-centrifuge tube (Ambion, Cat # AM12450) and spin it down on a desktop micro-centrifuge for ~10 sec to generate a noticeable bead pellet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully transfer remaining SSC and bead mix into a 1.5 ml micro-centrifuge tube (Ambion, Cat # AM12450) and spin it down on a desktop micro-centrifuge for ~10 sec to generate a noticeable bead pellet.

components.data: Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)

components.data: Remove any residual oil that got transferred into the 1.5 ml tube with a p200 pipette with low-retention pipette tip.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove any residual oil that got transferred into the 1.5 ml tube with a p200 pipette with low-retention pipette tip.

components.data: Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)

components.data: Wash the beads again in 1.5 ml of 6x SSC.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the beads again in 1.5 ml of 6x SSC.

components.data: Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)

components.data: Make a fresh batch of 200 µl RT mix for each barcoded bead aliquot, consisting of: 80 µl H2O, 40 µl Maxima 5x RT Buffer, 40 µl 20% Ficoll PM-400 (Sigma, Cat # F5415-50ML), 20 µl 10 mM dNTP (Takara Bio, Cat # 639125), 5 µl RNase Inhibitor (Lucigen, Cat # 30281-2), 10 µl Maxima H-RT enzyme (Fisher, Cat # EP0753), and 5 µl 100 µM Template Switch Oligo, AAGCAGTGGTATCAACGCAGAGTGAATrGrGrG (IDT, custom RNA oligo, HPLC purification).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Make a fresh batch of 200 µl RT mix for each barcoded bead aliquot, consisting of: 80 µl H2O, 40 µl Maxima 5x RT Buffer, 40 µl 20% Ficoll PM-400 (Sigma, Cat # F5415-50ML), 20 µl 10 mM dNTP (Takara Bio, Cat # 639125), 5 µl RNase Inhibitor (Lucigen, Cat # 30281-2), 10 µl Maxima H-RT enzyme (Fisher, Cat # EP0753), and 5 µl 100 µM Template Switch Oligo, AAGCAGTGGTATCAACGCAGAGTGAATrGrGrG (IDT, custom RNA oligo, HPLC purification).

source_data.title: 100 µM Template Switch Oligo, AAGCAGTGGTATCAACGCAGAGTGAATrGrGrG (IDT, custom RNA oligo, HPLC purification)

components.data: Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)

components.data: Wash the beads again in 300 µl of 5x Maxima H- RT buffer (Fisher, Cat # EP0753). A pellet of barcoded beads in each micro-centrifuge tube should have ~130,000 beads.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the beads again in 300 µl of 5x Maxima H- RT buffer (Fisher, Cat # EP0753). A pellet of barcoded beads in each micro-centrifuge tube should have ~130,000 beads.

components.data: Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Droplet breakage, washes and reverse transcription (RT)

components.data: After the supernatant is carefully removed from each bead pellet, add 200 µl of the above RT mix into each tube, and incubate it under gentle rocking or tumbling for 30 min at room temperature, and then at 42°C for 1.5 hr in a rotisserie-style hybridization oven, for a total of two hours.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After the supernatant is carefully removed from each bead pellet, add 200 µl of the above RT mix into each tube, and incubate it under gentle rocking or tumbling for 30 min at room temperature, and then at 42°C for 1.5 hr in a rotisserie-style hybridization oven, for a total of two hours.

components.data: Post RT wash, exonuclease I treatment and PCR
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Post RT wash, exonuclease I treatment and PCR

components.data: Post RT, each bead has cDNA barcoded with the bead’s unique barcode (BC) bound onto it, also referred to as a STAMP6. Wash each STAMP pellet with 1 ml of TE buffer containing 0.5% SDS (TE-SDS).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Post RT, each bead has cDNA barcoded with the bead’s unique barcode (BC) bound onto it, also referred to as a STAMP6. Wash each STAMP pellet with 1 ml of TE buffer containing 0.5% SDS (TE-SDS).

components.data: Post RT wash, exonuclease I treatment and PCR
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Post RT wash, exonuclease I treatment and PCR

components.data: Spin down to remove all supernatant and treat the STAMPs with exonuclease I (New England Biolabs, Cat # M0293L) as follows: add 20 µl of Exo I buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin down to remove all supernatant and treat the STAMPs with exonuclease I (New England Biolabs, Cat # M0293L) as follows: add 20 µl of Exo I buffer.

components.data: Post RT wash, exonuclease I treatment and PCR
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Post RT wash, exonuclease I treatment and PCR

components.data: Resuspend pellet in 1 mL of H2O, and count them, by mixing 10 µl of bead suspension with an equal volume of 20% PEG solution.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend pellet in 1 mL of H2O, and count them, by mixing 10 µl of bead suspension with an equal volume of 20% PEG solution.

components.data: Post RT wash, exonuclease I treatment and PCR
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Post RT wash, exonuclease I treatment and PCR

components.data: Resuspend aliquots of 5,000 beads in a PCR mix each consisting of 24.6 µl H2O, 0.4 µl 100 µM SMART PCRprimer, AAGCAGTGGTATCAACGCAGAGT (IDT, custom DNA oligo, standard desalting purification), and 25 µl 2x Kapa HiFi Hotstart Readymix (Kapa Biosystems, Cat # KK2602).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend aliquots of 5,000 beads in a PCR mix each consisting of 24.6 µl H2O, 0.4 µl 100 µM SMART PCRprimer, AAGCAGTGGTATCAACGCAGAGT (IDT, custom DNA oligo, standard desalting purification), and 25 µl 2x Kapa HiFi Hotstart Readymix (Kapa Biosystems, Cat # KK2602).

source_data.title: 100 µM SMART PCRprimer, AAGCAGTGGTATCAACGCAGAGT (IDT, custom DNA oligo, standard desalting purification)
2x Kapa HiFi Hotstart Readymix (Kapa Biosystems, Cat # KK2602)

components.data: Post RT wash, exonuclease I treatment and PCR
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Post RT wash, exonuclease I treatment and PCR

components.data:
Amplify the samples in separate wells on a skirted PCR plate, using the Eppendorf Thermocycler (Part # EP-950030020). 

i. Amplify Mouse PCR samples using the following PCR steps: 95°C for 3 min; then 4 cycles of: 98°C for 20 sec, 65°C for 45 sec, 72°C for 3 min; then 10 cycles of: 98°C for 20 sec, 67°C for 20 sec, 72°C for 3 min; and finally, 72°C for 5 min. Pool amplified mouse PCR products in batches of 4 wells or 16 wells. 


ii. Amplify Human PCR samples with either the previously mentioned PCR steps, or the following PCR steps: 95°C for 3 min; then 4 cycles of: 98°C for 20 sec, 65°C for 45 sec, 72°C for 3 min; then 12 cycles of: 98°C for 20 sec, 67°C for 20 sec, 72°C for 3 min; and finally, 72°C for 5 min. Pool amplified human PCR products in batches of 4 wells (16 total PCR cycles) or 16 wells (14 total PCR cycles).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Amplify the samples in separate wells on a skirted PCR plate, using the Eppendorf Thermocycler (Part # EP-950030020). 

i. Amplify Mouse PCR samples using the following PCR steps: 95°C for 3 min; then 4 cycles of: 98°C for 20 sec, 65°C for 45 sec, 72°C for 3 min; then 10 cycles of: 98°C for 20 sec, 67°C for 20 sec, 72°C for 3 min; and finally, 72°C for 5 min. Pool amplified mouse PCR products in batches of 4 wells or 16 wells. 


ii. Amplify Human PCR samples with either the previously mentioned PCR steps, or the following PCR steps: 95°C for 3 min; then 4 cycles of: 98°C for 20 sec, 65°C for 45 sec, 72°C for 3 min; then 12 cycles of: 98°C for 20 sec, 67°C for 20 sec, 72°C for 3 min; and finally, 72°C for 5 min. Pool amplified human PCR products in batches of 4 wells (16 total PCR cycles) or 16 wells (14 total PCR cycles).

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 47 of DroNc-seq step-by-step
source_data.annotation: Note that the total number of PCR wells from a single sample depends on the number of STAMPs collected in a DroNc-seq run from a given input of nuclei. A user may access the pool of STAMPs in different ways, depending on the number of nuclei they wish to retrieve and their sequencing setup. In particular, a user would typically access the pool of STAMPs once or more, each time taking only a portion of the STAMPs to generate a library, and repeat the process if more nuclei are desired. For our mouse and human brain samples, it was optimal to pool 20,000 STAMPs in each PCR reaction and then to pool 4 PCR wells together for the library preparation step. Depending on the amount of desired reads per nucleus and the sequencing yield, a user may pool a higher number of PCR wells in a single Nextera library, as we demonstrate here using 16-32 wells.
source_data.thread_text: Note that the total number of PCR wells from a single sample depends on the number of STAMPs collected in a DroNc-seq run from a given input of nuclei. A user may access the pool of STAMPs in different ways, depending on the number of nuclei they wish to retrieve and their sequencing setup. In particular, a user would typically access the pool of STAMPs once or more, each time taking only a portion of the STAMPs to generate a library, and repeat the process if more nuclei are desired. For our mouse and human brain samples, it was optimal to pool 20,000 STAMPs in each PCR reaction and then to pool 4 PCR wells together for the library preparation step. Depending on the amount of desired reads per nucleus and the sequencing yield, a user may pool a higher number of PCR wells in a single Nextera library, as we demonstrate here using 16-32 wells.
source_data.body: Note that the total number of PCR wells from a single sample depends on the number of STAMPs collected in a DroNc-seq run from a given input of nuclei. A user may access the pool of STAMPs in different ways, depending on the number of nuclei they wish to retrieve and their sequencing setup. In particular, a user would typically access the pool of STAMPs once or more, each time taking only a portion of the STAMPs to generate a library, and repeat the process if more nuclei are desired. For our mouse and human brain samples, it was optimal to pool 20,000 STAMPs in each PCR reaction and then to pool 4 PCR wells together for the library preparation step. Depending on the amount of desired reads per nucleus and the sequencing yield, a user may pool a higher number of PCR wells in a single Nextera library, as we demonstrate here using 16-32 wells.

components.data: WTA library QC and Nextera library prep
components.name: Section

source_data.section: WTA library QC and Nextera library prep

components.data: Use 550 pg of each sample library for fragmentation, tagging and amplification using the Nextera XT sample prep kit, 96 samples (Illumina, Cat # FC-131-1096), and custom primer, AATGATACGGCGACCACCGAGATCTACACGCCTGTCCGCGGAAGCAGTGGTATCAACGCAGAGT*A*C, (IDT, custom DNA oligo, HPLC purification) that enable selective amplification of the 3’ end, according to manufacturer’s instructions.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use 550 pg of each sample library for fragmentation, tagging and amplification using the Nextera XT sample prep kit, 96 samples (Illumina, Cat # FC-131-1096), and custom primer, AATGATACGGCGACCACCGAGATCTACACGCCTGTCCGCGGAAGCAGTGGTATCAACGCAGAGT*A*C, (IDT, custom DNA oligo, HPLC purification) that enable selective amplification of the 3’ end, according to manufacturer’s instructions.

components.data: Sequencing
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Sequencing

components.data: The libraries (at 2.2 pM (mouse, 16 wells pool), 2.7 pM (mouse, 4 wells pool) and 2.3 pM (human)) were sequenced on an Illumina NextSeq 500. We used NextSeq 75 cycle kits to sequence paired-end reads as follows: 20 bp (Read 1), 60 bp (Read 2), and 8 bp for Index 1, with Custom Read1 primer, GCCTGTCCGCGGAAGCAGTGGTATCAACGCAGAGTAC (IDT, custom DNA oligo, standard desalting), according to Illumina loading instructions.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The libraries (at 2.2 pM (mouse, 16 wells pool), 2.7 pM (mouse, 4 wells pool) and 2.3 pM (human)) were sequenced on an Illumina NextSeq 500. We used NextSeq 75 cycle kits to sequence paired-end reads as follows: 20 bp (Read 1), 60 bp (Read 2), and 8 bp for Index 1, with Custom Read1 primer, GCCTGTCCGCGGAAGCAGTGGTATCAACGCAGAGTAC (IDT, custom DNA oligo, standard desalting), according to Illumina loading instructions.

components.data: The sequencing cluster density and percent passing filter number from different experiments vary according to the quality of nuclei samples used, but were optimized at around a cluster density of 220 and a 90% passing filter.

source_data.annotation: Note that the bead syringe is loaded onto the syringe pump in an upside down position, along with a flea magnet inside the syringe and constant stirring, using external magnetic stirrer.
